name: Peery Hotel

reviews.text: The historical Peery is not for everybody. If you prefer large chain hotels with standard rooms and ammenities, try elsewhere. The Peery is a boutique hotel, and although some of the rooms are small, they have great character. I'm not sure the exact age of the building, but it has been really well maintained and is by far the most unique hotel in downtown SLC. Staff is incredibly nice and very helpful. One drawback for me -- lousy buffet breakfast. Otherwise, I'd have rated it higher.
reviews.title: Quaint and unique

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a business trip in SLC. We stayed at the Peery for one night, and I am so glad to be back. The city itself is undoubtly gorgeous, but the hotel, which is quite misleading from its lobby has some of the smallest rooms I have ever seen. Our room was basically 10X10, (not exaggerating in any way)..the bathroom is directly infront of the bed and the sink does not even fit in the bathroom, so it is placed next to the bed. The rooms are fairly old and not up to par like other hotels rooms (i.e. Marriott..). It was very hard not to feel clausterphobic. If you must stay here, choose a room with a king bed, not a queen, unless youre traveling alone. The location is great, but there is a Marriott just around the corner that looked a lot nicer, (I find that Marriott's are pretty reliable hotels). I hope this helped.
reviews.title: I am really surprised by the great reviews

reviews.text: Hotel is good, but rooms are very small. I asked for a larger room and was given handicapped room, the only larger room in hotel, I was told.
reviews.title: Good hotel, small rooms

reviews.text: Buffet breafast was reasonably priced and plentiful, but I would have preferred an a la carte menu. Rooms are very clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Wonderful Accomodations & Service

reviews.text: The Peery Hotel is the find of the year as far as I'm concerned. It beats any of the other so-called first-class hotels I've stayed in. The service was uncompromisingly friendly and helpful. The accomodations were superb down to the last detail. The views from second or third floor rooms of the mountains and city were spectacular. This is an historic hotel in a location that can't be beat in Salt Lake City. It's walking distance to any number of great restaurants, as well as a wondeful restaurant called Christopher's just off the lobby. The lobby itself is somewhere you'll want to sit in and just relax. Other niceties: free high speed internet at the business center, Starbucks stations on each floor in the morning, classical music in the lobby. Reasonable self-serve parking just steps away from the front door -- or valet if you prefer. If you like old-style elegance this is the best buy around!
reviews.title: Top notch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I had a great stay in a king suite for 2 nights in May. I booked the suite as I had read many reviews saying the standard rooms were too small. The one room suite was very roomy, very clean, and nicely appointed, with lots of light. The water pressure in the bathroom was excellent! The staff was very courteous and helpful. Temperature control was a little sketchy (I had to turn the thermostat off and on frequently to try to keep a comfortable temp.) The hotel is in a great spot; 10 minute walk to Temple Square, less than that to a good visitor center. Trolley line was only a couple blocks away. I highly recommend Squatter's Pub just down the street from the hotel. Excellent local beer and food.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.text: The Peery was a nice change of pace from the typical main-stream hotels I had been staying at. The Peery is located in downtown SLC within blocks of everything (a brewery is right across the street). The hotel itself had vintage decor with nice linens and wood work. The room was extremely small with the sink being inside the room rather then inside the bathroom. The hotel had a rustic charm although the bathroom could have used some cleaning. The front desk service was extremely pleasant and courteous. The room had free wireless internet and came with two papers (USA Today and local SLC paper) the morning after.
reviews.title: Unique vintage hotel

reviews.text: Was in town for a wedding and the party was staying at the Hotel Perry.
reviews.title: so-so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Hotel Perry, to be warm & comfortable, but defiantly lacked the amenities of your new modern hotels.
reviews.title: Charming Historic Cultural Treasure

likes.disliked: — The rooms are smaller than at some of the chain hotels

reviews.title: Don't stay here if you want to get any sleep
reviews.text: It appeared to have a good location with several nice restaurants in walking distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Peery was a lovely choice in a fantastic location in downtown Salt Lake. If you think that a Marriott is a "nice" hotel then you probably won't like the Peery. But if you want something other than bland, boring, middle-class American bad taste, you will find the Peery to be just your style. Quirky and fun, with a very helpful staff and a personality that leaves the chain hotels in the dust. Definitely only for those who don't want dull and predictable.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel, Great Value

reviews.text: The Peery Hotel is a lovely old hotel right in the heart of Salt Lake City. I spent three nights at the Peery whilst on business in SLC. The lobby and rooms have been lovingly restored. However, my queen sized room was really small. While I didn't experience the claustrophia that some of the other reviewers mentioned, I did find it difficult to shower in the tiny, tiny shower stall (and I am a rather petite person). The staff were all extremely helpful, and everyone went out of their way to ensure a pleasant visit. Joe, the valet/concierge, was especially gracious and very helpful in suggesting restaurants. The free wine/cheese reception on Wednesday night was a welcome treat. The hotel restaurant has an adequate, if somewhat pricey, breakfast buffet. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Beautiful old hotel

reviews.text: We picked the Peery Hotel for a getaway weekend in Salt Lake because it seemed quaint and full of character. The lobby is lovely, like previous reviewers have said. No disappointment there. But the rooms are very small. VERY small. I should have assumed they'd be small, based on the hotel's age and style.
reviews.title: Too small rooms, very thin walls!

reviews.text: The other main disappointment for us was thin walls between rooms. We should have asked for a different room--not to get a larger one, but so we could escape the noise of the apparently very in-love couple next door to us. We couldn't sleep a wink. We got up in the morning grumpy. We just had bad luck, but I'm warning you: the walls are thin.
reviews.title: Place is great!
valintines day at the peery
reviews.text: What a wonderful place! We stayed here based on a positive write-up in Fodor’s. Great location, beautiful lobby with starbucks coffee always available. We had a king suite and the room was very nice and huge! We only paid about a hundred bucks via their website. Marble bathroom and sink, sofa, coffee table and a work/card playing table, free coffee and water. The staff, while not numerous, bent backwards to meet all your requests. The head bellhop (Joe Ortalano) was a great source of info as to where to eat and see, and he also checked us in and took care of getting our luggage to our rooms. When we checked out, I called for my car which was valet parked. The young gal who answered was also working the desk. We took the elevator down, and the car was already there (the gal on the desk went to get the car). Like I said – the staff isn’t numerous but they went the extra mile to do what they can. I highly recommend this place. Next time instead of staying slopeside of near the mountains for skiing, we might just stay here and drive each day. It’s about 35-40 minutes to Alta/Snowbird or Solitude.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place. My wife and I came out to catch the end of the Alta ski season for 4-5 days and decided to cut costs by staying downtown. The hotel is nicely decorated, the rooms are spacious and tastefully furnished, there are all the amenities you would expect of a 4 or 5 star hotel, and the price is right. As I recall, we were given a parking tag for the next-door lot, so we did not have to pay. They have free Starbucks coffee in the morning, available on a table on each floor.
reviews.title: Excellent value, great service, good location, lots of charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DO NOT eat in the adjacent restaurant. It is not managed by the hotel but is a concession, and it is mediocre and overpriced. But who needs to eat there when there are so many good places downtown, including the Wasatch brewpub, directly across the street, which serves excellent food and some of Utah's best microbrews.
reviews.title: No Parking/Small Rooms

likes.liked: — No parking and rooms extremely small

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Peery Hotel for Christmas. While checking in I asked about parking because there didn't seem to be any. I was told that the parking lot costs $10/day or I could park on the street but would have to move the car every two hours. This was not listed in the hotel information. Also the rooms are extremely small. The room we received was so small I had to squeeze my body to get from the bed to the bathroom, no movement space. Also the bed was so hard I woke up in severe back pain half way through the night. I was given a new room the next day but it cost me an additional $30/day. I would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Best Little Secret in the downtown

reviews.text: I opted to stay here instead of one of the larger hotels while in Salt Lake for NTA, a travel convention. Since I work for a hotel chain, I have high standards!
reviews.title: Great little hotel
